sen.j: 成伯（せいはく、生没年不詳）は江戸時代初期の僧。
sen.e: Seihaku (year of his birth and death is not clear) was a Buddhist monk in the early Edo period.
Seihaku (year of his birth and death is not clear) was a Buddhist monk in the early Edo period.
Seihaku (year of his birth and death is not clear) was a Buddhist monk in the early Edo period.
His elder brother was Yoshimasa AZAI.
His elder brother was Yoshimasa AZAI.
His elder brother was Yoshimasa AZAI.

sen.j: 淀殿が父の浅井長政を偲んで1594年に建立した寺院、養源院の1世を務めた。
sen.e: He served the first chief of Yogen-in Temple, which Yodo-dono (lady Yodo) constructed in 1594 in remembrance of her father Nagamasa AZAI.
He served the first chief of Yogen-in Temple, which Yodo-dono (lady Yodo) constructed in 1594 in remembrance of her father Nagamasa AZAI.
